author: Staff Reporter
text:
Fire and rescue personnel recover body after a tiring search

A 15-member team of the Fire and Rescue Services department was engaged in the rescue operation at Munjurpattu in Vellore on Thursday.— Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

A 16-year-old boy died after he drowned in a well in Munjurpattu on Thursday.

Police said Anbarasan, a resident of Munjurpattu, was working in the family’s agricultural land along with his younger brother. He was studying in class XI.

The duo had gone to the farm well to wash their faces. Anbarasan had asked his brother to bring a vessel to fetch water.

However, on returning, the boy found that Anbarasan had drowned in the well. He could have slipped and fell into the well accidentally, police said.

His parents and villagers searched for him but in vain. The Fire and Rescue Services, Vellore was informed at 12 noon and a team rushed to the spot.

Personnel from the Fire and Rescue Services, Katpadi also joined the search operation. There were a total of 15 personnel at the spot.

The 70-feet deep well had 60-feet of water, making the search operation difficult. The personnel recovered his body close to 6.15 p.m.

Vellore taluk police have registered a case of death due to drowning.
title: 16-year-old boy drowns in farm well in Munjurpattu
